Package info6205.Graph.Problems.TravellingSalesMan.Algorithm.TwoOpt

Class TwoOpt<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue,EdgeWeight extends Comparable<EdgeWeight>>

java.lang.Object
info6205.Graph.Problems.TravellingSalesMan.Algorithm.TwoOpt.TwoOpt<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue,EdgeWeight>
Type Parameters:
NodeValue - Type of value the Node or vertices hold for the input graph
NodeKeyValue - Type of unique ID for a node or vertices of the input graph
EdgeWeight - Type of Edge Weight the edge will represent for the graph, this needs to implement Comparable
public class TwoOpt<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue,EdgeWeight extends Comparable<EdgeWeight>> extends Object
The `TwoOpt` class is an implementation of the 2-Opt algorithm, it has methods for parallel simulated annealing and normal 2 opt. It uses a parallelized version of the simulated annealing algorithm to find an optimal or near-optimal solution for the TSP. The `TwoOpt` class takes generic type parameters for NodeValue, NodeKeyValue, and EdgeWeight, which represent the values associated with nodes in the TSP graph, the keys associated with nodes in the TSP graph, and the weights of the edges between nodes, respectively.

  • Field Details

    • edgeWeights

      Map<Pair<Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>,Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>>,EdgeWeight extends Comparable<EdgeWeight>> edgeWeights
      A map that stores the weights of the edges between nodes in the TSP graph. The keys of the map are pairs of nodes, and the values are the Edge weights of the edge between those nodes. this should also contain node1 -> node2 and node2 -> node1 for undirected graph

    • segments

      List<int[]> segments
      A list of all the possible indices pairs for an two opt operation. Indices are the indices of the node present in the order

  • Method Details

    • parallelizeSimulatedAnnealingTwoOpt

      public List<Pair<List<Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>>,Double>> parallelizeSimulatedAnnealingTwoOpt(int parallelism, List<Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>> tour, Double graphWeight, long temp, double coolingRate, long maxIteration, int equilibriumCountForTemp, int equilibriumIncrease, boolean returnMinimum, boolean benchMarking)
      This Parallelizes the simulated annealing 2-Opt algorithm. The algorithm is run in parallel using the specified number of threads.
      Parameters:
      parallelism - The number of threads to use for parallel execution of the algorithm.
      tour - The initial tour for the TSP.
      graphWeight - The initial weight of the TSP tour.
      temp - The initial temperature for the simulated annealing algorithm.
      coolingRate - The cooling rate for the simulated annealing algorithm.
      maxIteration - The maximum number of iterations for the simulated annealing algorithm.
      equilibriumCountForTemp - The number of iterations to wait for equilibrium before reducing the temperature.
      equilibriumIncrease - The increase factor for the equilibrium count.
      returnMinimum - Whether to return only the minimum tour found by the algorithm and replace current tour with minimum tour
      benchMarking - Whether to enable benchmarking mode for the algorithm.
      Returns:
      A list of pairs, where each pair contains a tour and its corresponding weight. If returnMinimum is true, the list will contain only one pair with the minimum tour and its weight.

      public Pair<List<Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>>,Double> runSimulatedAnnealingWrapper(List<Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>> order, Double graphWeight, long temp, double coolingRate, long maxIteration, int equilibriumCountForTemp, int equilibriumIncrease)

    • runSimulatedAnnealing

      public Double runSimulatedAnnealing(List<Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>> order, Double graphWeight, double temp, double coolingRate, long maxIteration, int equilibriumCountForTemp, int equilibriumIncrease, Map<Pair<Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>,Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>>,EdgeWeight> edgeWeights)
      Runs the simulated annealing algorithm to find the minimum weight Hamiltonian path in the given graph.
      Parameters:
      order - a list of nodes representing the TSP path
      graphWeight - the weight of the initial TSP path
      temp - the starting temperature
      coolingRate - the cooling rate by which the temperature is dropped
      maxIteration - the maximum number of iterations to run
      equilibriumCountForTemp - the number of times to iterate at each temperature before cooling
      equilibriumIncrease - the amount to increase the equilibrium count for each temperature
      edgeWeights - a map of edge weights in the graph
      Returns:
      the minimum weight Hamiltonian path found by the algorithm
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs while running the algorithm

    • performTwoOpt

      public Double performTwoOpt(List<Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>> order, Double tsp)
      Performs the 2-opt algorithm to improve the given TSP tour order. it searches through every possible indices
      Parameters:
      order - a List of Nodes representing the TSP tour order
      tsp - the total weight of the TSP tour
      Returns:
      the updated total weight of the TSP tour after performing 2-opt algorithm
      Throws:
      Exception - if any error occurs while performing 2-opt algorithm

    • twoOpt

      private Double twoOpt(List<Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>> order, int smallerIndex, int largerIndex, Double currentWeightOfGraph)
      Performs the 2-opt algorithm between two nodes in the given TSP tour order and returns the change in weight caused by the algorithm.
      Parameters:
      order - a List of Nodes representing the TSP tour order
      smallerIndex - the index of the smaller node
      largerIndex - the index of the larger node
      currentWeightOfGraph - the total weight of the TSP tour before performing the 2-opt algorithm
      Returns:
      the change in weight of the TSP tour after performing 2-opt between the specified nodes
      Throws:
      Exception - if any error occurs while performing 2-opt algorithm

    • twoOpt

      private Double twoOpt(List<Node<NodeValue,NodeKeyValue>> order, int smallerIndex, int largerIndex, double temperature, Double currentWeightOfGraph)
      Applies the 2-opt heuristic algorithm to a given list of nodes with node indices "smallerIndex" and "largerIndex". Calculates the change in weight of the graph after swapping the edges between nodes "smallerIndex" and "largerIndex". If the new weight is less than the current weight of the graph, then it reverses the nodes between "smallerIndex+1" and "largerIndex" in the list and returns the new weight. If the new weight is greater than or equal to the current weight of the graph, it calculates a probability of accepting the new solution based on the current temperature and a random number generated by the algorithm. If the probability is greater than the random number, then it reverses the nodes and returns the new weight, else it returns null.
      Parameters:
      order - the list of nodes
      smallerIndex - the index of the first node to be swapped
      largerIndex - the index of the second node to be swapped
      temperature - the current temperature of the simulated annealing algorithm
      currentWeightOfGraph - the current weight of the graph
      Returns:
      the new weight of the graph after applying 2-opt heuristic, or null if the new solution is rejected
      Throws:
      Exception - if there is an error while performing 2-opt

    • allSegments

      public static List<int[]> allSegments(int n)
      Returns a list of all possible segments of a given size n, with segment size of 2. A segment is defined as two indices a and b, where a and b are integers between 0 and n-1, inclusive, and a invalid input: '<' b - 2.
      Parameters:
      n - the size of the segment.
      Returns:
      a list of all possible segments of size 2.
